newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SWIMMING-HYMAN SETS 50 BUTTERFLY WORLD MARK IN DEFEAT. [CORRECTED 08:05 GMT 20/4]
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-HYMAN SETS 50 BUTTERFLY WORLD MARK IN DEFEAT. [CORRECTED 08:05 GMT 20/4]

text.p: American Misty Hyman broke the women's 50 metres butterfly short-course world record on Saturday on her way to defeat in the 100 metres event at the world short-course championships.
Hyman touched at 50 metres in 26.55 seconds, 0.01 seconds inside the world mark set by Australia's Angela Kennedy in Sheffield, England, on February 12, 1995 (corrects from December 12, 1995).
Hyman ultimately finished third in the 100 metres race in which all three medallists improved on the 58.24 record set by Japan's Ayari Aoyama in Tokyo on March 28.
Jenny Thompson of the U.S. won in 57.79, followed by Cai Huijue of China in 57.92 and Hyman in 57.95.
